agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and produce food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.

site_schedule.name: Food Pantries
site_schedule.schedule: Monthly 1st and 3rd Sat 9:30am-11:30am -- Opposite Thurs 10:30am-11:30am (Produce Only)

site_eligibility: Living in Crawford County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in or call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Crawford County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Crawford County)

agency_desc: A locally governed Community Action Agency, that engages in making life better by providing opportunities, which empower people to improve the quality of life and address the causes and effects of poverty in Southern Indiana.
site_name: LINCOLN HILLS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION - NORTH CRAWFORD COUNTY
service_description: Provides a center-based comprehensive approach to school readiness by providing children with developmental and sensory screenings, as well as high quality, developmentally appropriate early childhood learning experiences in the areas of social-emotional well-being, language and literacy skills, cognitive and general knowledge, physical well-being, and motor development. Families are provided with resources and referral services, support for health and safety, as well as learning and leadership opportunities as they work towards achieving individual and family goals.
site_details: Call or visit the website for application information and locations. Applicants may be placed on a waiting list; those with the greatest needs will be served first.
site_eligibility: Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to those who have been victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy services for victims of any crime. Gives victims the opportunity to complete a Victim Impact Statement to submit to prosecutors prior to sentencing or plea negotiations. Additional assistance provided to victims in the filing of protective orders, court accompaniment, crisis intervention, case management, protective order assistance, and mobile advocacy. Special emphasis placed on victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault. Services may include safety planning and help applying for victims compensation benefits.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Crawford County
○Victims of any crime

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization focused on providing low cost medical care for the uninsured and underinsured.
service_description: Provides general health care for all ages. Services include physical exams, primary care, immunizations, obstetrics, and lab tests.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Community Clinics
site_schedule.schedule: Mon 8am-6:30pm, Tues-Thurs 8am-5pm; Fri 8am-3pm -- Closed daily noon-1pm

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization focused on providing low cost medical care for the uninsured and underinsured.
service_description: Provides general health care for all. Services include physical exams, primary care, immunizations, obstetrics, and lab tests.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Community Clinics
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, Fri 8am-5pm; Thurs 9am-4:45pm -- Closed daily noon-1pm

site_schedule.name: Obstetrics/Gynecology
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, Fri 8am-5pm; Thurs 9am-4:45pm -- Closed daily noon-1pm

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 15), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Crawford, Lawrence, Orange, and Washington County. Also serves as the areas Economic Development Corporation for Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Lawrence, Martin, Orange, Pike and Washington County.
site_name: LINCOLN HILLS BUILDING FOR THE ELDERLY - CRAWFORD COUNTY MEAL SITE
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship every weekday for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call the meal site or Hoosier Uplands at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 or older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides assistance programs to area persons in need.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Regular Pantry (including bread and produce): Limit one visit per month -- Bread and Produce Only: Up to three additional visits per month

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides assistance programs to area persons in need.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance with rent and utility bills to those in need. Assistance is limited to once per year.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance during the last 12 months

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Crawford County.
service_description: Maintains the Crawford County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.

site_schedule.name: Correctional Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Jail Phone: Daily 24 hours -- Scheduling Hours: Mon 8am-Wed noon

site_eligibility: Open
Open; serves Crawford County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Crawford County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line

site_schedule.name: Child Support Petition Filing Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Fri 8am-4pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-6pm; Wed 8am-noon -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Fri 8am-4pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-6pm; Wed 8am-noon -- Indiana KidsLine (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Fri 8am-4pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-6pm; and Wed 8am-noon

Varies by service

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Crawford County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Crawford County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. (Offers sandbags to Crawford County households during times of flooding.) Sand will brought in by truckload as needed.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.

site_schedule.name: County Offices of Emergency Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm; After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open; youth under 18 must have signed permission from parent or guardian -- For a library card: Living in Crawford County
Open; parental permission required for youth under age 18

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Crawford County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Crawford County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Crawford County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Crawford County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Crawford County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a soup kitchen.
service_description: Provides a sit-down or carry out meal twice monthly for those in need.
site_details: Walk in or carry out.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Milltown in Crawford County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, 9-1-1 emergency dispatch, and other police duties for the town of Milltown in Crawford County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. -- For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call the Crawford County Dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Milltown in Crawford County
Animal-related violations within Milltown town limits
Living in the town of Milltown in Crawford County

agency_desc: Provides municipal services for the town of Milltown in Crawford and Harrison County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, and groundskeeping of public properties in the town of Milltown in Crawford County.
site_details: Call for information or to submit a request or make a report.

agency_name: CRAWFORD COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: The District's mission is to proactively reduce the amount of waste going to landfills and incinerators through education, source reduction, reuse and recycling.
site_name: CRAWFORD COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT - ENGLISH
service_description: Maintains a drop-off site for collecting recyclables including: Glass (all colors), Plastics (1-7), no Styrofoam, Aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, Newspapers and magazines, Tires, Appliances and electronics
site_details: Call or visit website to find nearest drop-off location -- Bring recyclable to the drop-off -- Remove all items from trash bags before placing in bin
site_eligibility: Living in English City
